perturbation.original_text: 2.3 The first Development Fees payment shall be due forty-five days after the end of the Calendar Quarter in which the first Sale of a Development Product took place. Thereafter, WPD shall furnish to CNS Development Fees no later than forty-five days after the end of each Calendar Quarter for the Sale of Development Products through the end of such Calendar Quarter and shall further furnish CNS with a written statement setting forth an accounting showing the calculation of the Development Fees.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.3 The first Development Fees payment shall be due forty-five days after the end of the Calendar Quarter in which the first Sale of a Development Product took place. Thereafter, WPD shall furnish to CNS Development Fees no later than thirty days after the end of each Calendar Quarter for the Sale of Development Products through the end of such Calendar Quarter and shall further furnish CNS with a written statement setting forth an accounting showing the calculation of the Development Fees.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates a contradiction by stating that initial payments are due in 45 days, but subsequent payments are due in 30 days after the end of each calendar quarter. This discrepancy introduces uncertainty about payment deadlines and creates potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 6.2 Subject to any rights herein which survive termination, this Agreement will earlier terminate in its entirety: (i) upon thirty (30) calendar days written notice from either party if the other party materially breaches this Agreement, unless before the end of such thirty (30) calendar day notice period, the breaching party has cured the material default or breach to the non-breaching party’s reasonable satisfaction; or (ii) at any time by mutual written agreement between the Parties, subject to any terms herein which survive termination.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.2 Subject to any rights herein which survive termination, this Agreement will earlier terminate in its entirety: (i) upon thirty (30) calendar days written notice from either party if the other party materially breaches this Agreement, unless before the end of such sixty (60) calendar day notice period, the breaching party has cured the material default or breach to the non-breaching party’s reasonable satisfaction; or (ii) at any time by mutual written agreement between the Parties, subject to any terms herein which survive termination.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text changes the cure period for a material breach from 30 days to 60 days. This contradicts the initial statement of 30 days, making it ambiguous which timeframe is the correct one. It creates uncertainty about the actual time allowed to remedy a breach before termination occurs.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1 WPD hereby agrees to hold harmless and indemnify CNS, its officers, affiliates, employees, and agents (the “CNS Indemnitees”) from and against any and all third party claims, demands, causes of actions, costs of suit and reasonable and documented attorney’s fees (collectively “Claims”) caused by, arising out of, or resulting from WPD’s, its employees, agents’, affiliates’, licensees’, sublicensees’ or subcontractors’ (i) negligence or willful misconduct; (ii) breach of any warranty or representations set forth herein; (iii) breach or alleged breach of third party intellectual property rights; and (iv) use or sale of Development Products.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 WPD hereby agrees to hold harmless and indemnify CNS, its officers, affiliates, employees, and agents (the “CNS Indemnitees”) from and against any and all third party claims, demands, causes of actions, costs of suit, but excluding attorney’s fees (collectively “Claims”) caused by, arising out of, or resulting from WPD’s, its employees, agents’, affiliates’, licensees’, sublicensees’ or subcontractors’ (i) negligence or willful misconduct; (ii) breach of any warranty or representations set forth herein; (iii) breach or alleged breach of third party intellectual property rights; and (iv) use or sale of Development Products.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text removes attorney's fees from the indemnification clause. This directly contradicts the initial part of the same sentence that includes 'reasonable and documented attorney’s fees' in the definition of Claims, creating an internal inconsistency. It leads to confusion as to whether attorney's fees are covered under the indemnity.
